channel.title: C# Or C++ (Read For more info)
channel.description: I have a book on both Head First c# & Sam Teaches you c++ in 1 hour a day, Now i know what your thinking go with c# it's easier but. C++ Compilers are Portable(USB) where C# has to be Installed on your system and my free time these days Consists of my Free Periods i have at school And 2 hours after school. I can Spend 2hours a day learning c# or 3hours a day learning c++? What should i go with in anyone's Opinion?

item.title: C# Or C++ (Read For more info)
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

C# is 9999 easier, coming from someone that has learnt both, if you have a good reason to care about efficiency do C++ otherwise do C#

item.title: C# Or C++ (Read For more info)
item.dc:creator: @317guy 317guy
item.description:
@317guy wrote:

Thanks for all the info guys, I’ve been studying both languages enough to the point where I could draw something to the screen, I can see how C++is good I like it allot but C# is just more preferable. For just me coding alone. Thankyou all for your input

Read full topic
item.source: C# Or C++ (Read For more info)

item.title: C# Or C++ (Read For more info)
item.dc:creator: @siege_engine siege engine
item.description:
@siege_engine wrote:

I did a 6 month c++ programming work experience job, It was difficult to get around headers and pointers (coming from Java) but I learned quite a bit. I can’t really comment on the advantage/disadvantages between them as I have never used c#, but would recommend starting with c++ even though it is harder to learn. If you are required to use c# over c++ for whatever reason, you will easily pick it up. If you go with c++ I would recommend using Qt framework/IDE which is under LGPL. Also note that most applications that do heavy lifting use c++.

Read full topic
item.source: C# Or C++ (Read For more info)

Learn C# if you’re new to programming. It is much better to learn the basics with a language which isn’t a complete dick.
